description.message: Increment a URL or go to the Next Page. Supports Auto, Download, Crawl, and Scrape Incrementing. Uses 0 Background memory when inactive.

install_dialog_title.message: Thank You for Adding URL Incrementer

install_dialog_beta.message: Before getting started, you'll probably want to know the following things...

install_dialog_list_1.message: The default shortcut keys for increment is Ctrl+Shift+Up and decrement is Ctrl+Shift+Down. You can adjust them

install_dialog_list_2.message: This extension has a lot of options; however, you don't have to adjust anything if you don't want to.

install_dialog_email.message: Lastly, I want you to be 100% happy with URLI. If something isn't working right, please don't hesitate to email me for help:

save_regexp_icon.message: This is a Saved Regular Expression

increment_decrement_h3.message: Select the Part of the URL to Increment or Decrement

list_h3.message: Paste a List of URLs to Navigate Separated by Line Breaks

list_instructions.message: Please only enter full URLs, e.g. https://www.example.com instead of just www.example.com, and ensure they are separated by line breaks.

multi_button.message: Multi Incrementing - Click to increment up to 3 parts of the URL individually, simultaneously, or in ranges. See the Help Guide for more information.

list_button.message: List - Click to enter a custom list of URLs to navigate to (full URLs, separated by line breaks)

toolkit_instructions.message: Select and configure a tool, then click on URLI to have the work performed.

toolkit_tip.message: If download is enabled, you can generate a list of links, open the HTML file, and then use URLI again or another downloader to download them all!

toolkit_scrape_label.message: Scrape the document for data while crawling

scrape_instructions.message: In the first input, enter a selector used to query for element(s). In the second input, enter the property (or attribute) of the element(s) you want to scrape. See the Help guide for details.

crawl_tip.message: There are 5 classes of HTTP response codes: Informational (1XX), Successful / OK (2XX), Redirections (3XX), Client Errors (4XX), and Server Errors (5XX). If an Exception is caught while fetching a URL, it will be noted. The Details column will show the response text, redirected URLs, or exception messages. To stop crawling at anytime, close this window.

crawl_urli_click.message: Crawling these URLs may take a while, so sit back and relax and let URLI do all the work :)

auto_wait_label.message: Wait for the page to fully load

auto_badge_label.message: Show the times left in the icon

download_selector_all_label.message: To select all URLs, enter a single *

download_preview_blocked.message: Sorry, please wait a few more seconds ... scanning this page for URLs is either taking a really long time or URLI is not allowed to check for downloads on this page (e.g. browser pages). Please also try disabling and re-enabling Download again in the Options to make sure URLI has permissions.

download_help_extensions_title.message: These are the file extensions found on the page based on the URLs. If the URL doesn't contain the extension in it (e.g. .jpg), URLI won't find it. Important: Since these extensions are based only on the URL Strings (not the actual files), it's not guaranteed to be the file's true type.

download_help_tags_title.message: These are the HTML tags (e.g. ) that were found on the page.

download_help_attributes_title.message: These are the HTML tag attributes (e.g.

download_help_selector_title.message: This lets you directly use JavaScript's querySelectorAll() method on the entire document. You can use multiple CSS Selectors separated by commas for a more fine-grained selection. To select all the URLs, simply enter a single asterisk character *

download_help_page_title.message: Remember: This will only download the .html of the web page, unless the URL of the page points directly to a file (e.g. https://www.example.com/001.jpg)

download_filters_help.message: You can use text filters and regular expressions to include or exclude the URLs to download on each page. Multiple Includes and Excludes can be entered by separating them with commas. Also, if you want to use filters against all the URLs (e.g. not just file extensions), choose the "Use a custom selector" strategy and enter * for the selector. Note: Because the filters are evaluated as regular expressions, you may need to escape special regex characters like ? with a backslash if you want to match them literally, e.g. \?

download_subfolder_help.message: You can have each page's downloads stored in a subfolder under your root Downloads folder. Enter a subfolder name and you can also optionally include a starting number in the name that can be incremented if you check the Increment checkbox (if the Increment checkbox is not checked, the same subfolder will be used for all pages). Important: When saving to subfolders, the download's file name and extension will be based on the URL (not on the server's own internal file name), so be sure to examine the "Name" and "Ext" columns in the preview table first. If a file is missing a name or extension, it will default to saving in the root Downloads folder instead.

url_list_newline_error.message: URL List must contain at least one new line and have two or more URLs

selection_notalphanumeric_error.message: Select only alphanumeric characters or adjust the base type to match the selection

selection_notinurl_error.message: Selection has to be a part of the URL

selection_toolarge_error.message: Selection is too large; please select a smaller number or fewer characters

selection_base_error.message: Select a higher base to match characters in selection

selectionstart_invalid_error.message: Selection position must be from URL

interval_invalid_error.message: Interval has to be greater than 0 and less than Max

error_skip_permissions_error.message: To Error Skip, please enable Enhanced Mode in Options or set it to 0

error_skip_invalid_error.message: Error Skip has to be between 0 and 100

base_roman_invalid_error.message: A roman numeral couldn't be parsed (Latin is for upper and lower case; U216 and U217 are unicode)

base_decimal_invalid_error.message: A decimal number (in the format of #.# like "1.5") could not be parsed from the selection

base_custom_invalid_error.message: Custom base couldn't be validated against selection. There may be characters in your selection that aren't in the custom base's alphabet. Try viewing the help guide for examples

multi_count_error.message: To multi-increment, select at least two selections in the URL

toolkit_accept_error.message: Using URLI's Toolkit? Click on URLI (the extension mascot) to perform a toolkit action or please first close the toolkit by clicking the wrench to be able to accept another action

toolkit_auto_enabled_error.message: Can't use URLI's Toolkit while Auto is running; please use another tab or clear [X] and close and re-enter the Popup

toolkit_invalid_error.message: URLI's Toolkit configuration missing tool, action, or quantity

toolkit_crawl_quantity_error.message: Crawl URLs Quantity must be between 1 and 10,000

toolkit_crawl_seconds_error.message: Crawl URLs Delay (Seconds) must be between 1 and 600

toolkit_crawl_permissions_error.message: To Crawl URLs, please enable Enhanced Mode in Options to give URLI permissions

toolkit_tabs_quantity_error.message: Open Tabs Quantity must be between 1 and 100

toolkit_tabs_seconds_error.message: Open Tabs Delay (Seconds) must be between 0 and 5

toolkit_tabs_too_many_open_error.message: Too many tabs are open in this window (current tabs + quantity exceeds 100), please close some or open a new window

toolkit_links_quantity_error.message: Generate Links Quantity must be between 1 and 10,000

auto_next_prev_error.message: To use Next [>] Prev [<] with Auto, please enable Enhanced Mode in Options to give URLI permissions

auto_next_prev_shuffle_error.message: When using Auto with Next [>] Prev [<], shuffle can't be on

auto_list_action_error.message: When using Auto with List Mode, please only use the Increment Action

auto_times_invalid_error.message: Auto Times must be between 1 and 10,000

auto_seconds_invalid_error.message: Auto Seconds must be between 1 and 3,600

auto_download_seconds_error.message: When using Auto with Download, seconds must be 5 or higher

auto_download_repeat_error.message: When using Auto with Download, repeat can't be on

download_permissions_error.message: Please first enable Download in Options to give URLI permissions

download_subfolder_error.message: Download Subfolder can only contain the following characters: [A-Z] [0-9] _ - . or space

private_window_unsupported.message: Oops -- Sorry! URLI's Popup can't work properly in Private Windows due to the browser disallowing an Extension's Popup to directly use its Background process in this mode. Shortcuts and 1-Click Buttons still work in Private Windows and you can still use URLI's Popup in normal windows though!

ui_settings_p.message: Jazz it up and change the look and feel of the extension. If you prefer for URLI to not be visible in the UI, you can change the image to be the Extension icon.

interface_messages_checkbox_label.message: Show messages in the UI, such as if URLI is already activated

browser_shortcuts_p1.message: URLI is set to use Browser Shortcuts.

browser_shortcuts_p2.message: Browser Shortcuts only support limited keys, but you can enable URLI's Internal Shortcuts, which lets you use any key you want, and also includes mouse button shortcuts (Requires Permissions)

internal_shortcuts_p.message: URLI is set to use its internal shortcuts! Click on the text boxes and press the key(s) you'd like to set. Alt, Ctrl, Shift, and Meta keys can be used. You can also set mouse shortcuts and the number of clicks. Rocker gestures like "(Right) Left" mean hold Right, click Left. If you're on a touch-screen device, select Left for Touch. Note: Internal Shortcuts do not work in Incognito Mode.

one_click_buttons_p.message: Accessing URLI's buttons requires 2 clicks, but you can add 1-Click buttons to your toolbar. They use 0 Chrome memory when inactive!

shortcuts_editable_disabled_label.message: Prevent shortcuts from firing when typing or focused on an editable element

shortcuts_editable_disabled_help.message: This option prevents internal shortcuts from firing when you are typing or focused on an input, textarea, select, or an element that "isContentEditable." You may want to uncheck it if a website always auto-focuses you on an input after going to the next page.

quick_enable_help.message: If Quick is enabled, you can Increment or perform other actions instantly without having to setup or save a URL (Except for Clear, Return to Start, and Auto Pause)

mouse_click_speed_help.message: This affects the tolerance of multi-click shortcuts in ms (milliseconds). The higher this is, the more of a delay you can have between clicks. For example if you set this to 1000 ms, then you can wait up to 1000 ms between two clicks for it to count as a double click. 400 ms is about right for most people.

icon_feedback_enable_label.message: Enable icon feedback when performing actions

decode_uri_enable_label.message: Decode URLs so that all characters are displayed literally and unescaped

saved_urls_settings_p.message: Save your favorite URLs' settings such as selection and interval so you can use Quick Shortcuts when you visit them again without having to go into the Popup setup!

saved_urls_how_span.message: Important: Your privacy and how URLs are saved

saved_urls_how_title.message: To help keep your data as private as possible, URLI only stores your saved URLs locally on your device -- not in the cloud -- and only saves them as cryptographic hashes (not as plaintext). For more information, please view the Help Guide.

saved_urls_preselect_label.message: Always preselect the Save URL Heart in the Popup

saved_urls_wildcard_instructions_p.message: Enter a URL pattern (a wildcard or regular expression) to match multiple URLs, then adjust the Increment Decrement settings below for it, and click Save. If using a custom selection, please test and save it first. After saving the URL, please adjust the settings back to your preferred defaults.

saved_urls_wildcard_url_textarea.message: e.g. google.com or a regular expression like: google(.com|.co.uk)

saves_urls_wildcard_example.message: Wildcard Example to match all URLs containing example.com

saves_urls_regexp_example.message: Regular Expression Example to match all URLs containing example.com or example.co.uk

increment_decrement_settings_p.message: Change the way URLI pre-selects the number to increment and set default settings.

selection_option_smart.message: Select numbers smartly like "page=1" in the URL

selection_option_lastnumber.message: Select the last number in the URL

selection_option_firstnumber.message: Select the first number in the URL

selection_custom_url_label.message: Test URL String (Required, note this is saved)

selection_custom_help_label.message: For more testing and help, use

selection_custom_matchgroup_error.message: Match found, but not in group entered

selection_custom_matchindex_error.message: Match found, but not in index entered

selection_custom_matchnotvalid_error.message: couldn't be validated against selection and current base (try adjusting index)

error_skip_description.message: This checks if the next URL will return an HTTP error code (like 404) and increments again, skipping it up to 100 times until it finds the next good URL. If an error is encountered, the extension icon will flash with the error code (or flash "RED" for redirects). Note that some websites may choose to not return an error code. You may notice a few seconds delay when error skipping. Set to 0 to disable it. Important: This will make a request to the server each time to check the status code, and setting this value too high might cause the server to issue a "Too Many Requests" response. A value of 10 or less should be reasonably OK. Also, Please Note: This requires Enhanced Mode to be enabled.

error_skip_disclaimer.message: Note: Error Skipping requires Enhanced Mode permissions.

next_prev_settings_p.message: Some URLs may not have numbers, so URLI can increment using Next Prev links on the page. Keywords are all lowercase, ordered in priority, and separated by commas.

next_prev_keywords_prev_textarea.message: e.g. pnprev,previous page,< prev,« prev,prev,previous,newer posts,newer,前,<,<,‹,←

next_prev_popup_buttons_description_labe.message: Show Next Prev buttons (Requires Enhanced Mode)

auto_settings_p.message: Relax and let URLI auto-increment! Start Auto anytime by toggling it in the Popup. It supports multiple tabs at the same time, pause/resume, and repeat.

auto_start_label.message: Always toggle on Auto when the Popup starts

toolkit_settings_p.message: Originally made to test URLI, but unlocked for you to use as a non-standard feature! Crawl URLs, open tabs, or generate links. Click the wrench in the Popup to open.

toolkit_start_label.message: Always toggle on URLI's Toolkit when the Popup starts

download_disable_p.message: This isn't just any downloader! Use it with Auto to create an Auto Incrementer Downloader! Click the button to enable (grant permissions).

download_enable_p.message: Download is enabled! Start Downloading anytime by toggling the "DL" in the Popup.

download_experimental_disclaimer.message: Remember: Download is still an experimental feature! Please only use it for small and simple downloading tasks while incrementing.

download_settings_disclaimer.message: Before downloading, please open your Browser Settings and make sure the "Ask where to save each file" is unchecked and you've set a Download location.

download_start_label.message: Always toggle on Download when the Popup starts

enhanced_mode_enable_p.message: Enhanced Mode is enabled! You can Error Skip, Crawl URLs with URLI's Toolkit, and use Next Prev with Auto or Buttons.

enhanced_mode_disable_p.message: This unlocks URLI to its full potential! It lets you Error Skip, Crawl URLs with URLI's Toolkit, and use Next Prev with Auto or Buttons. Click the button to enable (grant permissions).

support_a.message: Support - Problems or Suggestions? Email me!

help_a.message: Help - View the User Guide on GitHub

thank_you_rainbow.message: Thank you for using URLI, a URL Incrementer

thank_you_wish.message: We want you to be 100% happy with URLI, so please email if any issues! URLI loves incrementing for you and wishes you an Incrementful Day!

credits_you.message: ... and most of all you for using URLI
